CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 25, 1971, pg. 18, reads: "ATTENDED OPENING - Among the prominent persons attending the recent opening of Heinz Hall for the Performing Arts were several members of the National Arts Council. Among them Jimilu Mason, well-known sculptor (left), award-winning actor of stage and screen, James Earl Jones (second from right) and Nancy Hanks (right), chairwoman of the National Council on the Arts and the National Endowment for the Arts - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: National Council on the Arts members, from left: sculptor Richard Hunt, sculptor Jimilu Mason, actor James Earl Jones, and chairperson Nancy Hanks, posed at airport
